issue.title: www.paramountplus.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://www.paramountplus.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.paramountplus.com)
### Comment
> When using Paramount plus on my Roku I can't play any shows.  I just get a spinning wheel.  If I point to another public DNS server it works fine.  This just started for me about a week ago.  There are Reddit post from other users showing similar issues 

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8pgknqksoi4ocoskwwcg4ssosks04oklvp9zkv5qk0.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/7do3coahig00okkwokkw4sks0kck0807b2oejhnfgw.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
Browser: | Roku

issue.title: mail.google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mail.google.com/mail/u/1/#starred/FMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2Fu%2F1%2F%23starred%2FFMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ) ### Comment > I could not open link from official Google Ads mail to open my Google Ads and download my invoice. No settings or filters were possible to include an exception so I had to turn off whole extension. While I wanted to create personal filter, even if that was possible, it's still not correct behavior. Either make exception for such official sites or invent a better system. We are not talking about ads anymore, we are talking about opening links from official emails from important services. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/5fil8012qroks8cswwo4sg4owgogok8ckyir3lt7lk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/gzjybfzaz280ss8cgsgs4gs0sswoo8opwhxg1zdcjk.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.127 MV3 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://netcinetv.lat/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnetcinetv.lat%2F) ### Comment > Netcine has been using methods to bypass adblockers, such as JavaScript and constantly changing its domain to circumvent AdGuard both in the browser extension and in the app. > I'd like the developers to teach me how to create a filter that can be updated whenever Netcine changes its domain and hosting. > > ### Screenshots
